meanings.definition: The property of being directionally dependent.
meanings.sent1: The anisotropy of the crystal made it stronger in one direction.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the anisotropy of the material to understand its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The anisotropy of the compass needle confused the hiker.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity showed anisotropy, shining brighter in certain projects.
meanings.sent5: The anisotropy of the fabric was evident as it stretched more in one direction.

meanings.definition: The state of having different physical properties in different directions.
meanings.sent1: The anisotropy of the wood affected its strength in various directions.
meanings.sent2: Engineers considered the anisotropy of the material when designing the structure.
meanings.sent3: The anisotropy of the ice cube caused it to melt unevenly.
meanings.sent4: His emotions displayed anisotropy, changing drastically depending on the situation.
meanings.sent5: The anisotropy of the rock made it break more easily along certain lines.
